Curious. I'm guessing that you haven't=
 set the environment variables
ANT_HOME, JAVA_HOME, etc. In Windows, this i=
s done using the System
Properties | Advanced | Environment Variables dialo=
g (I think - it's
been a while). Or you could just set them for an instance=
 of the
command interpreter using set JAVA_HOME=3Dsome\path
Then you can re=
ference them in an ant build.xml  file using <property
environment=3D"somep=
refix" /> and then have properties like
${someprefix.HTTPUNIT_HOME} - I thi=
nk that this might be a more usual
way of referencing them.
